conclusion: Analyze the paths step-by-step using the given images to determine which container the liquid will flow into.
The yellow liquid from A flows down and hits the red baffle.
The yellow liquid from A splits towards the left and right, flowing down.
The blue liquid from B flows down and hits the grey baffle.
The blue liquid from B moves towards the right and flows down, joining the path of the yellow liquid from A.
The orange liquid from C flows down and hits the grey baffle.
The orange liquid from C moves towards the left and flows down, joining the path of the yellow liquid from A.
All the liquids (yellow from A, blue from B, and orange from C) combine and flow towards the bottom.
The liquids pass through the narrow gap between the brown and red baffles and flow into container D.
All liquids from A, B, and C will flow into container D.
